programme.desc: Revealing the variety and importance of Jurassic dinosaur finds on Skye. Beairteas làraich chudromach dìneasar na linne Jurassic san Eilean Sgitheanaich.

programme.title: Trusadh - Na 20an/Twenties
programme.desc: 6/9. Tha Cass Ezeji a' coinneachadh ri daoine a th' anns na ficheadan. Cass Ezeji meets people in their 20s.

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: 13/13. Drama Gàidhlig stèidhichte ann an Leòdhas. Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis.

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: 20/20. The colourful and unusual world of Fraochy Bay. The residents gather to toss their cabers and see who comes out on top.

programme.title: Slighe Anndra
programme.desc: 3/8. Iain Mac'ìllemhìcheil a' tadhal air Eaglais na h-Alba air feadh na Roinn-Eòrpa. John Carmichael explores the Church of Scotland, in locations throughout Europe.

programme.title: Skipinnish Aig a' Chaisteal (Shorts)
programme.desc: 7/10. Skipinnish le Last of the Hunters aig cuirm-chiùil bho Chaisteal Dhùn Èideann. Skipinnish perform Last of the Hunters at a concert from Edinburgh Castle.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: 9/26. Ernest becomes a museum guard so that Célestine can paint there. But a painting is stolen and he becomes the focus of suspicion!

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: 1/10. Linda asks Meaban and Moo to find three rectangular items. Their hut is full of junk so the pair need to have a good rummage in order to find them!

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 26/40. Tha Fuigheag airson geama "ruaig" a chluich le damhan-allaidh an-diugh. Fuigheag wants to play 'chase' with a spider today.

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 27/40. Tha Boban a' dèanamh dèideag airson Fuigheag an-diugh. Boban makes a toy for Fuigheag today.

programme.title: Gasta a' Ghraineag/Happy the Hoglet
programme.desc: 2/26. Chan eil Gasta math air dannsa ach the e airson fheuchainn. Gasta isn't the best dancer, but he wants to try it.

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: 15/20. Tha cuideigin a' falbh leis a' bhainne aig Madame! Saoil cò am mèirleach? Someone is stealing the milk from Madame! Who is the thief?

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 68/80. Kim Carnie reads Greta agus na Fuamhairean, written by Zoe Tucker, illustrated by Zoe Persico and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart.

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: 6/13. Tha cerebral palsy air Eòseph ach tha e cur roimhe coiseachd gu pàrtaidh a cho-là breith. Eòseph has cerebral palsy but is determined to walk to his own birthday party.

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 12/13. Tha dùbhlan aig Flix is Burma - tha aca ri bhith càirdeil ri chèile. Flix and Burma have a challenge, they must be friendly with one another.

programme.title: Bogaisean is...
programme.desc: ...Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles. 13/52. Tha Smuigean na chadal 's tha rud ri nochdadh bhon aisling aige. Smuigean is asleep and something appears from his dream.

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 3/12. Tha Ehrinn a' farpais an aghaidh preasantairean CBBC ALBA ach saoil cò shoirbhicheas? Ehrinn competes against the CBBC ALBA presenters, but who will emerge victorious?

programme.title: A' Chùil
programme.desc: 7/14. Choirstaidh makes fossils by recycling used coffee grounds.

programme.title: Rùm Gu Rùm, Le Erica
programme.desc: 6/6. Erica Macpherson goes on a creative design adventure through the Highlands and Islands of Scotland.

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: 21/26. Artist and teacher Críostóir de Piondargás chats to Joy in the studio and Calum Maclean is inspired at an artistic garden on the edge of the Pentland Hills.

programme.title: An Là
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, nàiseanta is eadar-nàiseanta gach là cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Vets: Gach Creutair Beo
programme.desc: 1/8. A French bulldog and some feisty wildcat kittens are among the animals treated.

programme.title: An Cogadh Fuar: Cold War Stories
programme.desc: 2/3. The world is gripped in fear over the Cuban missile crisis and Polaris arrives into Holy Loch. Contains some strong language and some upsetting scenes.

programme.title: Binneas - Na Trads
programme.desc: 7/8. Featuring Laura Jane Wilkie and band recorded at the Trad Awards in 2024.

programme.title: Seòid a' Chidsin - The Kitchen Coves
programme.desc: 5/6. Tha na seòid a' dèanamh an rud às fheàrr à biadh a th' air fhàgail aca. The lads make the most of ingredients and leftovers.

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions: Dluth an Daimh
programme.desc: 2/6. Julie Fowlis and Muireann Nic Amhlaoibh present highlights from Transatlantic Sessions. Contains some strong language.

programme.title: Sar-Sgeoil - The Cone-Gatherers
programme.desc: Cathy MacDonald explores the fact behind the fiction in the novel The Cone-Gatherers. Cathy Dhòmhnallach a' lorg fìrinn air cùl ficsean anns an nobhail The Cone-Gatherers.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Bayeux Tapestry
programme.desc: Experts from archaeologists to astrophysicists offer new insights on the Bayeux Tapestry, an artefact which, despite its fame, has remained shrouded in mystery.

programme.title: The Mystery of the Desert Kites
programme.desc: Documentary following an international team of archaeologists and researchers as they explore the extraordinary groups of megastructures that stretch across the Arabian desert.

programme.title: The One Jasper Carrott
programme.desc: 2/3. Jasper Carrott hosts a comedy special, featuring stand-up, sketches, a reprise of The Detectives with Robert Powell and a song with his house band, with Rick Wakeman and Bev Bevan.

programme.title: Discovering the Music of Antiquity
programme.desc: The discovery of an ancient music score in the Louvre sets researchers on a mission to recreate the music as it was originally heard by the Greeks 2,400 years ago.

programme.title: Battlefield Britain: Hastings
programme.desc: Peter and Dan Snow on the battles that shaped our nation, using state-of-the-art graphics. The story of the turbulent events culminating in the Battle of Hastings in 1066.

programme.title: Patrick Marber Remembers... After Miss Julie
programme.desc: Patrick Marber looks back on his 1995 adaptation of August Strindberg's classic play Miss Julie.

programme.desc: The Verdict: Claire is excited about giving Haley and Alex a great time on Bring Your Daughter to Work Day, but the staff don't make it easy. Gloria is thrilled to be on jury duty.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Dillman: When a prank goes disastrously wrong, things at the Nine-Nine take a distinctly Agatha Christie turn.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A frantic Sienna turns to Dodger, but before she can reveal the truth, a threat stops her in her tracks... Things don't look good for Tony, and tension rises between a mother and daughter.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna's getaway hits the brakes when her family step in. Meanwhile, Froggy wants to bring his family back together, and a pact is made when two secret relationships are discovered.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip featuring animals and food, from the always hilarious Tube that is Rude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Handlebar: Gordon Ramsay takes on a time warp at the Handlebar restaurant and lounge in Mount Sinai, New York, where the owners are stuck in the 80s with an unenthusiastic chef.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Stakeout: Peralta and Boyle go on an eight-day stakeout, putting a strain on their friendship. Holt's nephew visits and makes an instant impression on Diaz.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Beach House: The team are excited about visiting Boyle's beach house for a detectives-only weekend getaway, until Peralta ruins the fun by inviting Captain Holt.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Kids Are All Fight: When Homer finds an old roll of film and has it developed, the family take a trip down memory lane to when Bart and Lisa were always fighting.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Let's Go Fly a Coot: Bart develops a crush on Milhouse's Dutch cousin. And the family learn about Grampa's days in the Air Force.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Race of Superhumans and a Letter to Alf: Sheldon agrees to help Missy with her maths homework. Georgie joins a bible study group to get closer to Veronica.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tummy Ache and a Whale of a Metaphor: Sheldon spends some days in hospital, but he's the world's worst patient and his behaviour takes a toll on everyone.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Commencement: Cam finally gets a chance to shine when he's asked to preside over the high school graduation ceremony at the last minute, while Jay gives the commencement address.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Year of Birthdays: As the birth of Haley and Dylan's twins approaches, the family look back at how each of them celebrated their birthdays this past year.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Einstein Approximation: Sheldon is baffled by a formula he's working on, so he gets a less mentally taxing job at the Cheesecake Factory to kick-start his creativity.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Large Hadron Collision: Sheldon is gutted when Leonard asks Penny to go to Switzerland on Valentine's Day to see the world's largest particle accelerator instead of him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Precious Fragmentation: The gang squabble over a ring that they believe was used in The Lord of the Rings movies, and Sheldon seems to be turning into Gollum.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: (2011) Fantasy action-adventure. Jason Momoa stars as Conan, who sets out to kill the evil warlord who massacred his village when he was young. With Stephen Lang and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: The Lighthouse
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-nominated psychological horror starring Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson. A pair of lighthouse keepers dangerously descend into insanity on a remote island.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Up For It?
programme.desc: Pigeon fancier Matthew Whittleton discusses keeping pigeons with Briar. Zoe McWhinney teaches Jayden about creating BSL poetry. Plus, sketches and VV.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
programme.desc: (1984) It's time to put on make-up. It's time to light the lights. Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzy, the Blues one and the gang embark on a musical adventure as they try to make it on Broadway.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3
programme.desc: (2018) Spooky animated family comedy. On a monster-friendly cruise, Dracula (Adam Sandler) falls in love - with a vampire slayer!

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: (1997) Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet star in James Cameron's Oscar-winning epic. Lovers from across the social divide meet on the doomed luxury liner.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Uncharted
programme.desc: (2022) Going-for-gold action. Tom Holland and Mark Wahlberg compare abs as they scour the globe for an olde explorer's lost gold. The heat is on. The time is right. Only the best survive.

programme.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
programme.desc: (2018) Crime thriller with Jeff Bridges, Jon Hamm, Dakota Johnson and Chris Hemsworth. A group of shifty strangers collide in a deserted motel that has its own buried secrets.

programme.title: Sheroes
programme.desc: (2023) She-heroes: action-with-attitude. Three young women transform into a Generation Z version of Charlie's Angels to rescue their mate from a drug lord in Thailand. Cue guns and bikinis.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: (2020) Touching adventure with Harrison Ford, based on Jack London's classic novel. A big, friendly hound finds himself unwittingly travelling across late 19th-century North America.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: The G
programme.desc: (2023) Gritty crime thriller with Dale Dickey. An elderly couple get fleeced for their house and savings, so granny - aka The G - goes on a vengeful rampage. Be careful who you mess with.

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: (2014) Tense thriller with Tom Hardy, James Gandolfini, Noomi Rapace and Matthias Schoenaerts. Two cousins get into trouble with the gangsters who use their bar to launder illicit cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
programme.desc: (2021) Ryûsuke Hamaguchi's triptych of short dramas tells the stories of three different women caught up in very different romantic relationships. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: (1970) Oscar-winning drama portraying the bombing of Pearl Harbor, from both American and Japanese perspectives. With Joseph Cotten and So Yamamura.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Time Bandits
programme.desc: (1981) Fantasy comedy. David Rappaport stars as the leader of rebel dwarves who kidnap a boy, Craig Warnock, and take him on adventures across time. With Sean Connery and John Cleese.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?

programme.title: Nope
programme.desc: (2022) Western-infused sci-fi chiller with Daniel Kaluuya and Keke Palmer as cash-strapped horse trainers who try to supplement their income by filming alien goings-on at their ranch.

programme.title: Summer of Soul
programme.desc: (2021) Joyous, Oscar-winning documentary about the Harlem Cultural Festival: six huge, free, star-studded neighbourhood festivals that encapsulated 1969's swelling Black cultural pride.

programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: The Call of the Wild
programme.desc: (2020) Touching adventure with Harrison Ford, based on Jack London's classic novel. A big, friendly hound finds himself unwittingly travelling across late 19th-century North America.

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: The G
programme.desc: (2023) Gritty crime thriller with Dale Dickey. An elderly couple get fleeced for their house and savings, so granny - aka The G - goes on a vengeful rampage. Be careful who you mess with.

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: (2014) Tense thriller with Tom Hardy, James Gandolfini, Noomi Rapace and Matthias Schoenaerts. Two cousins get into trouble with the gangsters who use their bar to launder illicit cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune and Fantasy
programme.desc: (2021) Ryûsuke Hamaguchi's triptych of short dramas tells the stories of three different women caught up in very different romantic relationships. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: (1970) Oscar-winning drama portraying the bombing of Pearl Harbor, from both American and Japanese perspectives. With Joseph Cotten and So Yamamura.

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: (2019) Touching comedy-drama. An ageing golden retriever (voiced by Kevin Costner) tells the story of his life with his best pal, a budding Formula 1 driver.

programme.title: Time Bandits
programme.desc: (1981) Fantasy comedy. David Rappaport stars as the leader of rebel dwarves who kidnap a boy, Craig Warnock, and take him on adventures across time. With Sean Connery and John Cleese.

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: (1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?

programme.title: Nope
programme.desc: (2022) Western-infused sci-fi chiller with Daniel Kaluuya and Keke Palmer as cash-strapped horse trainers who try to supplement their income by filming alien goings-on at their ranch.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the rich and aromatic flavours of South Asia, with his first dish being vada pav, a speciality from Mumbai consisting of a spicy fluffy potato patty that is battered and fried and served up with a selection of chutneys. Lisa Snowdon meets the team at Mr Bombay to find out about the tasty treats they serve up to marketgoers and cooks a lamb curry, while actress Donna Preston makes a vegetarian dish of spiced paneer skewers with mango salad

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Tony Audenshaw, Tamzin Outhwaite and Phil Tufnell 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Married couple Trevor and Steph from Castle Donington, salsa-dancing brothers Lloyd and Lionel, and St Albans couple Sophie and Joe try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Deal or No Deal: Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Strictly Come Dancing's Motsi Mabuse and her sister, Dancing on Ice's Oti, join forces to take on the banker and win money for charity. Supported by their friends, family and a few famous faces, can Motsi and Oti choose the right boxes and resist the banker's tempting cash offers until just the right moment in order to take home a fortune for their chosen charity?

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Andy from Flintshire, Sue from Lancaster, Kirsty from Bristol and Arjun from Solihull pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross confronts Charity and asks if Mack left because he found out about their infidelity, while Ray puts doubts in Dylan's head and Belle dumps Kammy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Aadi's loved ones hatch a plan to keep him in Weatherfield, while Brody and the Metcalfes learn Joanie's fate. Abi appeals to Tracy's better nature, Theo schemes to scupper Todd's night out, and a panicky Asha reflects on the events of a traumatic shift

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The tranquillity of the serene village of Colden Vale is shattered when beloved wife and mother Tara Dunning mysteriously vanishes, with initial speculations lingering on the possibility she might have intentionally disappeared. However, a chilling discovery alters the course of the inquiry and suggests more sinister motivations and the stakes are raised after a second person goes missing and is found dead shortly afterwards

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Cold Case Forensics: The Murder of Stephen Lawrence
programme.desc: The racist murder of Stephen Lawrence in southeast London in 1993 remained unsolved for more than a decade. Eventually forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team were brought in by a new investigation to look again at the evidence. Here she and her colleagues, as well as detective Clive Driscoll and the Lawrence family's lawyer, Imran Khan, detail how this landmark case was finally brought to trial

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. They'll have to produce delicious dishes with the added pressure of not only impressing the chefs, but their friends and family who will also be in the studio including Hugh's friend David Baddiel

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy's Taste of Florida
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads towards Florida's East Coast where he tests his surfing abilities in the Atlantic waves on New Smyrna Beach before meeting local chef David for a culinary lesson in classic Southern Grits. Jimmy then visits the Kennedy Space Centre where tour guide Richard takes him to see the iconic launchpads and he talks space food with former astronaut Winston Scott

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Heathrow's test and trace policy, following Joel, the manager of the airport's testing centre, as he leads the charge in trying to reduce passenger stress and makes sure that everyone gets the right test for the right country. Things are heating up in immigration, where Passenger Experience Manager Suki has an emergency on his hands, and Security Officer Estefania gets an unexpected makeover

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Grimsby Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second-round match, which comes from Blundell Park. League Two Grimsby defeated Shrewsbury Town 3-1 in the previous round to reach this stage for the second successive season. Their reward is this plum tie against a team that has won this trophy on six occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2022/23 season

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Adil Ray, featuring Cathy and Dermot, a married couple of 46 years from Bollington, Sasha and Jono, a couple from Nottingham, and fiancees Ben and Yaz from Reading. They work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leave with nothing

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julie from Spalding, Lorcan from Coventry, Shirin from London and Tim from Manchester pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dylan tells Ray he wants a break from working with him, while Moira is horrified when she realise she has been duped. Kyle recognises Dylan

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Grimsby Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second-round match, which comes from Blundell Park. League Two Grimsby defeated Shrewsbury Town 3-1 in the previous round to reach this stage for the second successive season. Their reward is this plum tie against a team that has won this trophy on six occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2022/23 season

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ross confronts Charity and asks if Mack left because he found out about their infidelity, while Ray puts doubts in Dylan's head and Belle dumps Kammy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Aadi's loved ones hatch a plan to keep him in Weatherfield, while Brody and the Metcalfes learn Joanie's fate. Abi appeals to Tracy's better nature, Theo schemes to scupper Todd's night out, and a panicky Asha reflects on the events of a traumatic shift

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: The tranquillity of the serene village of Colden Vale is shattered when beloved wife and mother Tara Dunning mysteriously vanishes, with initial speculations lingering on the possibility she might have intentionally disappeared. However, a chilling discovery alters the course of the inquiry and suggests more sinister motivations and the stakes are raised after a second person goes missing and is found dead shortly afterwards

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Cold Case Forensics: The Murder of Stephen Lawrence
programme.desc: The racist murder of Stephen Lawrence in southeast London in 1993 remained unsolved for more than a decade. Eventually forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team were brought in by a new investigation to look again at the evidence. Here she and her colleagues, as well as detective Clive Driscoll and the Lawrence family's lawyer, Imran Khan, detail how this landmark case was finally brought to trial

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as four new stars - reality TV star Ekin-Su Cülcüloglu, actor and comedian Hugh Dennis, author and interiors expert Kelly Hoppen, and former footballer Shaun Wright-Phillips - and their mentors, cook for their loved ones. They'll have to produce delicious dishes with the added pressure of not only impressing the chefs, but their friends and family who will also be in the studio including Hugh's friend David Baddiel

programme.title: Jimmy's Taste of Florida
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads towards Florida's East Coast where he tests his surfing abilities in the Atlantic waves on New Smyrna Beach before meeting local chef David for a culinary lesson in classic Southern Grits. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Julie from Spalding, Lorcan from Coventry, Shirin from London and Tim from Manchester pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dylan tells Ray he wants a break from working with him, while Moira is horrified when she realise she has been duped. Kyle recognises Dylan

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Grimsby Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 8.00pm). All the action from the second-round match, which comes from Blundell Park. League Two Grimsby defeated Shrewsbury Town 3-1 in the previous round to reach this stage for the second successive season. Their reward is this plum tie against a team that has won this trophy on six occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming in the 2022/23 season

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Sean's Scotland Postcards

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Nicki Shields presents action from the seventh meeting of the season, featuring the 19th, 20th and 21st races, which came from Knockhill. Tom Ingram currently led the way in the standings, followed closely by Ash Sutton after a victory in the third race last time out at Croft

programme.desc: Derek's back in his old stomping ground of Luton, to meet an old schoolmate who is saying goodbye to his 1912 De Dion Bouton.

programme.desc: Jack's off to West Yorkshire to extract a 1987 Peugeot 205 GTI from a garage in a narrow lane. It's one of the more prized 1.9s and has been stored safely away for many years.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Piccadilly Circus to Gravesend: Michael Portillo journeys from Piccadilly Circus to Gravesend, visiting an exotic West End store that was popular among Victorian women.

programme.desc: Dundee to Aberdeen: Michael Portillo travels from Dundee to Aberdeen, stopping off at Glamis Castle, where the Queen Mother grew up, and making an excursion into the Eastern Highlands.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Elgin to Loch Ness: Michael Portillo visits Lossiemouth and Inverness. His journey ends at Loch Ness, where he joins a Deep Scan research team searching for the elusive monster.

programme.desc: Derek picks up some emerging sporting classics from the far east when three Datsun Zs appear, and an unusual lot arrives that run on caterpillar tracks not wheels.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash

programme.title: Nazi Hunters

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Colt & Kalashnikov: Long before Henry Ford, Samuel Colt is the true father of mass production. Ironically, it was the inadequacy of Soviet factory production which made the AK47 so effective.
